title: (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No.
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Planning and Development
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Planning and Development 

(Amendment)(No. 2) Regulations 2022. 

(2) These Regulations shall be included in the collective citation the 

Planning and Development Regulations 2001 to 2022. 

Interpretation
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited planning development (amendment)(no 2) regulation 2022 (2) regulation shall included collective citation planning development regulation 2001 2022 interpretation

title: (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No.
heading: In these Regulations —
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations — 

“Principal Regulations” means the Planning and Development Regulations, 
2001 (S.I. No. 600 of 2001); 

Content of planning applications generally

title: (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No.
heading: 3. The Principal Regulations are amended –
text_raw:
3. The Principal Regulations are amended – 

(a) 

in article 22(2) by substituting for paragraph (g) the following: 

“(g) where the applicant is not the legal owner of the land or 

structure concerned – 

(i) 

(ii) 

(iii) 

the written consent of the owner to make the application, 
or 
in the case of a proposed development, or part of a 
proposed development, that is in, on, over or under a 
public road, written confirmation that the proposed 
development concerned is to be undertaken by a statutory 
undertaker having a right or interest to provide services in 
connection with the proposed development, or 
in the case of a proposed development, or part of a 
proposed development, where the applicant is Irish Water 
and it is the intention of the applicant to compulsorily 
acquire the land for the purpose of such development, 
written confirmation of the intention of such applicant to 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 11th November, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [565] 3 

compulsorily acquire the land in question should planning 
permission be granted for the proposed development, and 
the statutory provision or provisions under which it 
intends to seek the compulsorily acquisition of such 
lands”, 

and 

(b) 

in Schedule 3, in the accompanying documents checklist 
at the end of Form No. 2, by inserting “or article 
22(2)(g)(iii)” after “article 22(2)(g)(ii)”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

9 November, 2022. 

PETER BURKE, 

Minister of State at the Department of Housing, Local 
Government and Heritage. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [565]

title: (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No.
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

This amendment enables Irish Water to apply for planning permission for 
infrastructure on land where it is not the landowner but where it would be the 
intention of Irish Water to compulsorily acquire the land in the event planning 
permission is granted.
